guide.introduction: If you cross a drawdio with a paintbrush, you get amazing sounds.
guide.introduction_rendered:
If you cross a drawdio with a paintbrush, you get amazing sounds.

Relevant parts
  • Drawdio kit or the DIY $10 Drawdio
  • Paintbrush
  • Zip ties
  • Copper tape
Tools
  • Hot Glue gun & hot glue

parts.text: Drawdio kit or the DIY $10 Drawdio
parts.notes: If you make a drawdio, type in the search box:"drawdio"

lines.text: You'll need a drawdio to make this device. Go to makeprojects.com/DIY $10 Drawdio to make a cheap version. Or, you can order a kit from the makershed. Either way, you'll have to make one. If you are making the one from the makershed, go to ladyada's website for instructions.
lines.text_raw: You'll need a drawdio to make this device. Go to makeprojects.com/DIY $10 Drawdio to make a cheap version. Or, you can order a kit from the makershed. Either way, you'll have to make one. If you are making the one from the makershed, go to ladyada's website for instructions.

lines.text: Use a zip tie or 2 to mount the drawdio to the paintbrush like so.
lines.text_raw: Use a zip tie or 2 to mount the drawdio to the paintbrush like so.

lines.text: Use a little hot glue to mount it in place.
lines.text_raw: Use a little hot glue to mount it in place.

lines.text: Use copper tape to mount one wire (that was supposed to go to the lead) around the paintbrush. This is where you are going to hold. Use a 2-3 inch piece of copper tape to use the other wire to the bristles.
lines.text_raw: Use copper tape to mount one wire (that was supposed to go to the lead) around the paintbrush. This is where you are going to hold. Use a 2-3 inch piece of copper tape to use the other wire to the bristles.

lines.text: Dip the bristles into some water (salt water works better). Spread some water across a surface like old wood. While keeping the drawdio touching the water, touch your finger to the other side of the water. (Where the red circle is.) If it isn't working, maybe the water isn't connected.
